metadata.Title: CVE-2014-0246 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - low
metadata.Description:
SOSreport stores the md5 hash of the GRUB bootloader password in anarchive, which allows local users to obtain sensitive information byreading the archive.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-0246` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

sosreport - 3.4-1~ubuntu14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: sosreport package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.4-1~ubuntu14.04.1').
